image.altText: Two photos of men side by side speaking in an interview.

props.synopsis: There are two major beneficiaries of the recent turmoil within the South Australian Liberal Party, though it's unlikely either would openly describe themselves that way.

title.children: Why have these two leaders benefited from one party's turmoil?

image.altText: Albanese smiles as a crowd surrounding him cheers.

props.synopsis: Labor has promised to bake in fee-free TAFE at a rally setting the party up for the coming federal election, saying if the government is re-elected it will make 100,000 fee-free places permanently available each year,

title.children: Albanese promises to lock in 100,000 fee-free TAFE places every year, in pseudo campaign launch

image.altText: Two fire trucks watering burnt grass on a large paddock

props.synopsis: Two men have been arrested and a family of three have been taken to hospital after a fire burnt through 33 hectares of grass in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Pair facing bushfire-related charges after shed and glasshouses damaged in blaze

image.altText: Aerial close up of aqua water, small whale calf on the left next to a larger whale, both with white patches on heads

props.synopsis: Scientists say southern right whale numbers have recovered in the Great Australian Bight Marine Park, and are now calling for further protection as they move into new areas.

title.children: Southern right whales are in abundance off Australia's south coast, but new threats have emerged

image.altText: Lady with blonde hair wearing a dress and smiling

props.synopsis: Would you travel 900 kilometres just to catch up friends? Meet the women who live in some of Australia's most remote places who do just that.

title.children: Outback women travel hundreds of kilometres to catch up and connect

image.altText: Smiling woman in glasses looking at camera holding up book with little girls smiling face on the cover.

props.synopsis: Teacher's debut picture book based on her daughter's telltale messy hair hopes to inspire children to unplug from screens and make their own adventures outdoors.

title.children: Teacher's tale of knotty-haired, five-year-old a celebration of outdoor play

image.altText: A composite image showing aspects of South Australia's late-term abortion debate.

props.synopsis: South Australia's late-term abortion debate has played out inside parliament, on the steps outside the building, and on social media platforms — and campaigner and academic Joanna Howe has been at the centre of that debate.

title.children: How social media has influenced South Australia's debate on abortion

image.altText: A close up of a shiny red quandong fruit growing on a tree

props.synopsis: Quandongs fetch high prices but overcoming inconsistent supply remains a challenge to growing a market.

title.children: Fruit retailing at $100 per kilo has huge demand but farmers are struggling to grow them

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: A new poll from a pollster rated among country's most reputable predicts Kamala Harris will claim a surprise victory in Iowa — a state her rival Donald Trump had been expected to win easily — as the US presidential campaign enters its final stages.

title.children: US election 'oracle' predicts surprise for Harris as Trump rails at 'fake' poll

image.altText: Vice President Kamala Harris and Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese toast

props.synopsis: The US is Australia's most important military ally, one of our biggest trading partners and a critical diplomatic partner in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: What the US election result might mean for Australia

image.altText: A lady outside a melbourne suburban home

props.synopsis: As the Reserve Bank meets to consider whether to cut interest rates, housing affordability is again centre stage of the political debate. A federal inquiry is considering whether there's a need to ease restrictions on banks about how much they can lend out to first home buyers.

title.children: Inquiry looking into how to make it easier for first home buyers to get a loan

image.altText: illustration of hexagons representing the electoral college. Held by a black and white hand

props.synopsis: Nor, mind you, does Kamala Harris.

title.children: Donald Trump doesn't need the popular vote to win the election

image.altText: Chandler-Mather and Pocock stand on the lawns of parliament chatting, Pocock wearing a wide-brimmed hat.

props.synopsis: Independent senator David Pocock and several teal MPs take up arms on behalf of the federal government to pressure the Greens to back two housing bills before parliament.

title.children: Independents pressure Greens to break housing stalemate after Queensland election losses

image.altText: A composite image of five people, four men and a woman. Their faces are in boxes.

props.synopsis: One by one, these insiders left the world's biggest social media companies, troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people.

title.children: 'I wouldn't want to expose my child to that': Social media insiders warn safeguards have been cut

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: Chris Henggeler is the only grazier in Australia using feral donkeys to regenerate his remote property. Now he's on the wrong side of the law.

title.children: Meet the grazier going feral in a groundbreaking 'illegal' experiment to regenerate his land

image.altText: A modestly dressed king walks down the high street of a Spanish village with body guards and a crowd surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Residents scream "get out" as King Felipe VI and other officials tour one of the worst-hit areas of flood-ravaged Valencia City.

title.children: Spanish king and queen pelted with mud as locals vent anger over government's flooding response

image.altText: Donald Trump puts his finger in an aircraft shelter

props.synopsis: Donald Trump, for all his sins, has proved himself to be an astute politician with an unerring ability to dominate the news cycle and garner attention. As he would see it, all publicity, no matter how awful, really is good publicity.

title.children: Trump could win the election, despite his long rap sheet. His 1997 book holds clues for how he works

image.altText: Max Verstappen driving his F1 car in the rain at the Interlagos circuit in Brazil

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has one hand on what would be a fourth Formula 1 drivers' championship, coming from 17th to complete one of the great victories.

title.children: Max Verstappen puts one hand on world title with historic win from 17th, Norris's title hopes on life support

image.altText: A police officer standing with weapons around his belt, his back to the camera and an earpiece in his ear.

props.synopsis: A gangland shooting and brawl that involved dozens of people on Friday has sparked anger and promises for change in France.

title.children: 'Web of corruption': Why a deadly 60-person brawl could spark a French crackdown on drug trafficking

image.altText: A child is immunised via droplets into the mouth in a clinic.

props.synopsis: Israel's military denies responsibility for the strike, which occurred during a pause in fighting. UNICEF has described the incident as "disturbing".

title.children: Four children injured in drone strike on Gaza polio vaccination centre

image.altText: Two Melbourne Cup horses are led through the mounting yard at Flemington ahead of a track gallop in 2023.

props.synopsis: Irish trainer Willie Mullins brings Vauban and Absurde back for shots at Melbourne Cup glory after both missed out last year under the Flemington sun.

title.children: Star trainer Willie Mullins eyes Irish success in Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Several people seen swimming and relaxing at the beach, seen from far away

props.synopsis: If Australia doesn't have a population plan, how will it meet the challenges of coming decades?

title.children: Australia is clearly bad at managing population growth and it's time for a plan

image.altText: A purple lightning strike fills the sky.

props.synopsis: Victorian authorities brace for difficult fire conditions with high temperatures and storms with dry lightning forecast this week.

title.children: Dry thunderstorms could spark hundreds of fires in Victoria this week, weather bureau warns

image.altText: Woman driving van with dog next to her

props.synopsis: Lesley Larkin's family feels like time is running out to catch her killer as the 40th anniversary of her violent Noosa death approaches.

title.children: Who killed Lesley Larkin? Family's desperate push to solve one of Australia's most baffling cold cases

image.altText: A young man looks at his smartphone.

props.synopsis: A web of 'delusional' regulatory decisions has essentially turned some perfectly good phones into e-waste.

title.children: Customers suddenly find their new phones can't make calls or send texts

image.altText: A man sitting at a park bench

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's south-east are calling for better signage to discourage people from feeding feral birds.

title.children: Melbourne residents fed up with bird poo on public eating spaces call for council action

image.altText: Sejr Deans in a hospital gown lies in a hospital bed and holds up two fingers while friends pose for a photo around him.

props.synopsis: After being the first player signed to the Tasmania JackJumpers, Sejr Deans went on to represent Australia and then later moved to the US to follow his dream. But a year into a contract, he suffered a cardiac arrest.

title.children: Sejr was the JackJumpers' first-ever signing, but a cardiac arrest nearly ended his basketball dream

image.altText: Spirit V resting against tugboat

props.synopsis: Severe winds have caused one of the two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels to break loose from its outfitting quay at a shipyard in Finland, but the extent of damage is yet to be determined.

title.children: 'Hurricane-force' winds caused new Spirit ships to come loose and drift into an embankment in Finland

image.altText: Illustration of different women sliced up to make one person.

props.synopsis: In the past six months alone there have been countless stories of schoolboys targeting both peers and teachers with varying degrees of tech-assisted gendered bullying, harassment, and abuse.

title.children: 'But what if she sent them to him first?': Devastating words from a teenager show how growing up has changed

image.altText: A left-handed Melbourne Renegades WBBL player hits the ball high towards the boundary on the leg side during a game.

props.synopsis: Renegades captain Sophie Molineux and Stars opener Yastika Bhatia post half-centuries to lead their Melbourne teams to wins in a WBBL double-header.

title.children: Molineux fires as Renegades win last-ball WBBL thriller against Adelaide, Stars down Hurricanes

image.altText: Pal Bidong, known in music circles as Peezy.

props.synopsis: The 20-year-old victim of a fatal shooting in Melbourne's inner north has been remembered as having a "beautiful heart" and always putting others first, as police and community groups call for calm.

title.children: 'Loved by many': North Melbourne shooting victim identified as up-and-coming rapper

image.altText: Collage of Australian politicians on Red.

props.synopsis: Of Red's 150 million active users, almost 700,000 are based in Australia. That presents both opportunities and risks for Australian politicians.

title.children: China's super app 'Little Red Book' was branded as a lifestyle platform. It's now a PR battleground for some Australian politicians

image.altText: A graphic of a red up arrow next to a percentage sign, overlaid on a street view of a row of houses.

props.synopsis: Even though inflation is within the RBA's ideal range, economists are banking on high interest rates hanging around for a little bit longer.

title.children: Here's when the big four banks reckon interest rates will go down

image.altText: Kemi Badenoch speaks at a podium after winning the leadership contest.

props.synopsis: Kemi Badenoch, the first black woman to lead a major British political party, pledges to bring the right-of-centre Tories "renewal" by pushing for a smaller state and rejecting identity politics.

title.children: Kemi Badenoch replaces Rishi Sunak as leader of UK Conservative Party
